actions-list.actionItem: The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Friday, June 14, 2024 through Monday, June 24, 2024 as a "district work period."
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Ms. Caraveo asked unanimous consent that she may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 4213, a bill originally introduced by Representative Buck, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 8070.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 217
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 202

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Sherrill moved to recommit to the Committee on Armed Services.
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8070.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the James amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 272
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 188

actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on the James amendment No. 228, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kamlager-Dove demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1287, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the James amendment No. 228.

An amendment, offered by Mr. James,  numbered 228 printed in Part B of House Report 118-551 to amend section 1725 to bolster the current report language on South Africa and to incorporate a full review of the bilateral relationship between the United States and South Africa.
On agreeing to the Doggett amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1287, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Doggett amendment No. 134.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Doggett,  numbered 134 printed in Part B of House Report 118-551 to establish a panel of experts to review contracts for major weapons systems, spare parts, and services to determine whether the Department paid excessive prices and make recommendations to ensure the Department pays fair and reasonable prices in future contracts.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 56, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Norcross demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1287, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 56.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 56 printed in Part B of House Report 118-551 to require a report from the Secretary Defense on the use of taxpayer-funded official time.
On agreeing to the Rogers (AL) amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1287, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 40 minutes of debate on the Rogers (AL) amendment en bloc No. 5.
On agreeing to the Rogers (AL) amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1287, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 40 minutes of debate on the Rogers (AL) amendment en bloc No. 4.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8070 â€” "To authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2025 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Dean of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Bhai Mohan Singh, Gurdwara Singh Sabha of Yakima, Yakima, Washington.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
